intro: Solidago altissima subsp. altissima, commonly known as the tall goldenrod, is a perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. The plant produces numerous yellow flowers arranged in panicles, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in wetlands, meadows, and along stream banks.
